alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 4:53PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...KIT CARSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO...CHEYENNE... THOMAS...RAWLINS...NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN...WESTERN DECATUR AND SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 450 PM MST/550 PM CST/, an area of wintry precipitation was located in east-central Colorado and northwestern Kansas, moving east at 45 mph. A trained spotter reported slick road conditions with black ice at mile marker 59 on Interstate 70 eastbound around 430 PM MST/530 PM CST. Visibilities have dropped to as low as one- quarter of a mile due to blowing snow and areas of dense fog. Locations impacted include... Colby, Goodland, Burlington, Oberlin, St. Francis, Atwood and Stratton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 64. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 390 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 179 and 229. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling in these hazardous conditions.
